title: Milo Djukanovic Is Defeated in Montenegro’s Presidential Election
description: The incumbent, Milo Djukanovic, conceded  to Jakov Milatovic, who had campaigned on pledges to root out corruption and organized crime.

title: Sanna Marin’s Party Loses in Finland Election
description: Prime Minister Sanna Marin’s party was outpolled by a rival that stressed economic concerns. Petteri Orpo of the National Coalition Party may now come to power, but coalition talks will be daunting.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Donald Trump’s Legal Tactics
description: Also, China’s lessons from the war in Ukraine and Volodymyr Zelensky denounces Russia’s U.N. role.

title: Israel Moves Forward With Far-Right Plan for National Guard
description: Itamar Ben-Gvir, one of the most extreme voices in the Israeli government, had long sought to create a national guard. Ministers agreed on Sunday to set up a committee to discuss next steps.

title: Vladlen Tatarsky, Russian Military Blogger, Is Killed in St. Petersburg Explosion
description: Vladlen Tatarsky represented a radical wing of pro-invasion bloggers and activists who backed Moscow’s war but also criticized what they saw as the flaws in the Russian Army.

title: Pope Francis, Back From the Hospital, Thanks Palm Sunday Crowds
description: Francis arrived in St. Peter’s Square in an open-topped jeep on Palm Sunday, the beginning of a week of major ceremonies before Easter.

title: Maria Lvova-Belova, the Children’s Rights Advocate Accused of Russian War Crimes
description: Maria Lvova-Belova says she is running a humanitarian evacuation of abandoned Ukrainian children. The International Criminal Court accuses her of abducting them wholesale.

title: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen Balances China and U.S.
description: Known for her quiet pragmatism, Tsai Ing-wen has ushered in a new era of American cooperation as worries about Chinese aggression rise.

title: Blinken Demands Release of Evan Gershkovich in Call With Lavrov
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken spoke with his Russian counterpart after the American basketball star Brittney Griner, who was detained for almost 10 months by Russia, urged the U.S. government to use “every tool possible” to secure Evan Gershkovich’s release.

title: Forest Fire Breaks Out on a Mountain in Central Seoul
description: Dozens of nearby homes were evacuated as firefighters hurried to contain the blaze on one of Seoul’s most popular hiking sites.

title: Fight Over Corruption and Congo’s Mining Riches Takes a Turn in Washington
description: Dan Gertler, an Israeli billionaire, is pressing President Biden to remove sanctions that were imposed on him for bribe-fueled transactions in the impoverished African country.

title: Refusing to Evacuate, Ukrainian Residents Go Underground
description: Huddled in basements just over a mile away from the front lines of Avdiivka, over 1,800 residents are refusing to be rescued from one of the most active battlegrounds in eastern Ukraine.

title: Deadly Attack Hits Ukrainian Town After Zelensky Denounces Russia’s ‘Absurd’ Security Council Presidency
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that permitting Moscow its monthlong chairmanship of Security Council meetings showed “the complete bankruptcy of such institutions.”

title: Maggie Haberman on Donald Trump
description: We talk with a Trump reporter to prepare you for the week when he will likely be arrested.

title: Residents of Avdiivka in Ukraine Refuse to Leave Battered City
description: Huddled in basements just over a mile away from the front lines of Avdiivka, over 1,800 residents are refusing to be rescued from one of the most active battlegrounds in eastern Ukraine.

title: Trump Revival Is Ever-Present Possibility for World Leaders
description: The indictment last week of Donald J. Trump has not changed the calculations of many world leaders who view his political resilience as inevitable.

title: No More Blank Checks: Saudi Arabia Clamps Down on Regional Aid
description: The kingdom used to send money to poorer countries like Egypt with few strings attached. But it is increasingly leveraging its economic power for influence in the Middle East and beyond.
